text.div:
Generated Narrative: StructureDefinition ext-R5-SubstanceDefinition.sourceMaterial

NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
Extension 0..1Extension(4.0.1)Material or taxonomic/anatomical source
Slices for extension 0..*ExtensionExtension
Slice: Unordered, Open by value:url
extension:type 0..1ExtensionClassification of the origin of the raw material. e.g. cat hair is an Animal source type
url 1..1uri"type"
value[x] 0..1CodeableConceptClassification of the origin of the raw material. e.g. cat hair is an Animal source type
Binding: ValueSetR5SubstanceSourceMaterialTypeForR4 (0.0.1-snapshot-3) (example): A classification that provides the origin of the substance raw material.
extension:genus 0..1ExtensionThe genus of an organism e.g. the Latin epithet of the plant/animal scientific name
url 1..1uri"genus"
value[x] 0..1CodeableConceptThe genus of an organism e.g. the Latin epithet of the plant/animal scientific name
Binding: ValueSetR5SubstanceSourceMaterialGenusForR4 (0.0.1-snapshot-3) (example): The genus of an organism, typically referring to the Latin epithet of the genus element of the plant/animal scientific name.
extension:species 0..1ExtensionThe species of an organism e.g. the Latin epithet of the species of the plant/animal
url 1..1uri"species"
value[x] 0..1CodeableConceptThe species of an organism e.g. the Latin epithet of the species of the plant/animal
Binding: ValueSetR5SubstanceSourceMaterialSpeciesForR4 (0.0.1-snapshot-3) (example): A species of origin a substance raw material.
extension:part 0..1ExtensionAn anatomical origin of the source material within an organism
url 1..1uri"part"
value[x] 0..1CodeableConceptAn anatomical origin of the source material within an organism
Binding: ValueSetR5SubstanceSourceMaterialPartForR4 (0.0.1-snapshot-3) (example): An anatomical origin of the source material within an organism.
extension:countryOfOrigin 0..*ExtensionThe country or countries where the material is harvested
url 1..1uri"countryOfOrigin"
value[x] 0..1CodeableConceptThe country or countries where the material is harvested
Binding: http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/ValueSet/ValueSet-R5-country-for-R4 (required): Jurisdiction codes
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-SubstanceDefinition.sourceMaterial"
value[x] 0..0Value of extension

Documentation for this format

name: ExtensionSubstanceDefinition_SourceMaterial
title: Cross-version Extension `R5.SubstanceDefinition.sourceMaterial` for use in FHIR R4
description: This cross-version extension represents the FHIR R5 element `SubstanceDefinition.sourceMaterial` for use in FHIR R4.
purpose:
This extension is part of the cross-version definitions generated to enable use of the
element `SubstanceDefinition.sourceMaterial` as defined in FHIR R5
in FHIR R4.

The source element is defined as:
`SubstanceDefinition.sourceMaterial` 0..1 `BackboneElement`

Across FHIR versions, the element set has been mapped as:
*  R5: `SubstanceDefinition.sourceMaterial` 0..1 `BackboneElement`
*  R4B: `SubstanceDefinition.sourceMaterial` 0..1 `BackboneElement`
*  R4: `SubstanceSpecification.sourceMaterial` 0..1 `Reference(http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/SubstanceSourceMaterial)`

Following are the generation technical comments:
Element `SubstanceDefinition.sourceMaterial` is mapped to FHIR R4 element `SubstanceSpecification.sourceMaterial`.

element.short: Material or taxonomic/anatomical source
element.definition: Material or taxonomic/anatomical source for the substance.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: Unique id for inter-element referencing
element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

element.short: Extension
element.definition: An Extension

element.definition: A classification that provides the origin of the raw material. Example: cat hair would be an Animal source type.
element.requirements: Element `SubstanceDefinition.sourceMaterial.type` is mapped to FHIR R4 structure `SubstanceSpecification`, but has no target element specified.
